pingball.simulation.collidable

Class FixedCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.collidable.FixedCircle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collidable

    public class FixedCircle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collidable
    A mutable fixed circle FixedCircle object is a circle that represents a fixed circle at some position. It has the center, radius, reflection coefficient and optionally the center of rotation and angular velocity. Even though it is called FixedCircle, the object can mutate by rotating around the center of rotation. It, however, cannot move with linear velocity Rep-Invariant: -

      • FixedCircle

        public FixedCircle(physics.Vect center,
           double radius,
           double reflectionCoeff,
           physics.Vect centerOfRotation)
        Create a FixedCircle object
        Parameters:
        center - a vector representing the center location of the MovingCircle
        radius - a double number representing the radius. Must be nonnegative
        reflectionCoeff - a double number representing the reflection
        centerOfRotation - a vector representing the location of the center of rotation

      • timeUntilCollision

        public double timeUntilCollision(Ball ball)
        Return the it takes for this object to collide with the ball. If the collision will not occur, this method return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Specified by:
        timeUntilCollision in interface Collidable
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that will collide with this object
        Returns:
        a double representing the time it takes for this object to collide with the ball

      • collide

        public void collide(Ball ball)
        Collide this object with ball, changing the velocity of the ball. This method assume the two objects are at the point of impact. Note that this method mutates the ball.
        Specified by:
        collide in interface Collidable
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that will collide with this object
